p: Glycyrrhizin ( 26) ( Fig. 7), the active component of liquorice roots, has been reported to possess moderate antiviral activity against SARS-CoV in vitro with an EC 50 of 300 g/mL [ 58], however its full mechanism is unclear. Glycyrrhizin affects cellular signaling pathways such as protein kinase C; casein kinase II; and transcription factors such as activator protein 1 and nuclear factor kB (NF-ÎºB).
